column1: How does this person feel about his service to the community ? [SEP] I am always one to share , have been like that for a long time . And that includes the estate . column1: Why is the narrator going on a trip to Antigua with friends ? [SEP] Next weekend we had planned to go to la Antigua from Friday to Satudar , because Sunday was the school race of 7 kilometers , which I hope I would finish without problems , but I really doubt about it . Anyway , Friday my friends and I , after school , will go in a bus to La Antigua . It is our last year in school , so we are trying to plan everything together , because it could be our last time having fun in that way . [SEP]  (A) None of the above choices . (B) The narrator and friends are having a scuba excursion . (C) The narrator and friends are having a farewell bash . (D) The narrator and friends are having a light jaunt .
column2: The narrator and friends are having a farewell bash .

column1: What type of communication is probably being utilised here ? [SEP] Yes , even this is cooler than you are . Photo : Getty Images Yesterday , Vice and The Village Voice made us feel very old . The two publications , which despite their waning relevance manage in some way to be edgy in a manner that eludes us , both have slideshows from a hipster party that occurred over the weekend . The event kind of struck us as both spontaneous and secretive in exactly the way something hip should be -- because if it was n't a secret , it would n't have happened in the first place . It was the kind of party that should have taken place in Williamsburg , but it was even cooler . [SEP]  (A) Sarcasm (B) Amusement (C) None of the above choices . (D) Disdain
column2: Sarcasm

column1: What may Heather eventually stop doing [SEP] Heather had really changed . She continued to be kind and she still had a bright smile on her face . column1: What book may I be currently reading ? For all these things do the nations of the world seek after : and your Father knoweth that ye have need of these things . But rather seek ye the kingdom of God ; and all these things shall be added unto you . [SEP]  (A) The Bible (B) None of the above choices . (C) The Hunger Ganes (D) The Qu'Ran

column2: I may be hungry .

column1: Why may the narrator be more stressed out than usual ? [SEP] Well last few days have sucked . I was doing ok on an early afternoon schedual and getting back from work around midnight instead of going IN at midnight , but since doing that all by itself is more taxing than anything else I can think of and the last few days have just been HELL on top of it , yeah it 's all fucked up back to where it was again . column1: How long has this piece of art been in our family ? [SEP] Madonna and Child - Crayon on Paper - Campbell Neil - 1965 I ' ve probably studied this piece of art more than any other . I was about seven when my parents acquired and placed it in the living room of the home I grew up in . The artist , Campbell Neil , was a family friend and my father 's insurance agent . [SEP]  (A) It 's been there for a long time . (B) It 's been there for only a little while . (C) None of the above choices . (D) It has n't been there for long .
column2: It 's been there for a long time .

column1: What most impressed the narrator about the show ? [SEP] Aside from one line flub , which happens every once in a while , I thougt the acting was flawless . Each of the women showed , through vocal tone and facial expression , precisely what the character was feeling . They were also remarkable as singers , and I loved each of their musical numbers . [SEP]  (A) None of the above choices . (B) The singing . (C) The theme . (D) The backdrop .
column2: The singing .

column1: What may have sent you into a mad rage ? [SEP] All of this sent me into a mad rage , I just wanted to get out , get free , and get away . Soon after , we arrived outside of our home city , Belay . Its gates welcomed us while we lay out of breath , looking to the sky . [SEP]  (A) I could n't get past the gates . (B) I was stuck in Belay . (C) I was stuck somewhere . (D) I was stuck at home .
column2: I was stuck somewhere .

column1: What will the aunt and dad want to do with them ? [SEP] Well , last month we took a vacation to the beach and while there I scrapped a few pictures . I did these as 4x6 pictures so I could print them out at Wal - mart . I uploaded them to their website and picked the Wal - mart closest to us at the beach . So , yesterday I went to order copies of those pictures to give to my aunt and dad and ordered the pictures . [SEP]  (A) Put them in photo albumss (B) Burn them . (C) None of the above choices . (D) Memorize them
column2: Put them in photo albumss

column1: What may be your reason for never being able to forget Butch ? [SEP] I also have the friends I made from America , like my roommate Sarah and my birthday buddy Butch . Even if Butch and I lose touch over the years , he 's one of the people that I 'll never be able to forget . How could I , when he went to Morocco and Gibraltar with me just because I asked him to last minute ? That was amazing . [SEP]  (A) He was my roommate for years . (B) None of the above choices . (C) He did crazy trips with me without preparing . (D) He did crazy trips with Sarah without preparing .
column2: He did crazy trips with me without preparing .

column1: Why did the writer have so much free time ? [SEP] Little write up about what I got up to over Bank Holiday , certainly not everyones cup of tea but what the hey the results are pretty good . We visited the following sites ... Former German work camp not far out side of Crewe . Very little info to be found on the net but as of June 16 , 1945 the U.S. France and the U.K. held a combined total of 7,500,000 German POW 's and DEF 's . During the two World Wars many hundreds of Prisoners of war were lodged in Shropshire 's 18 POW camps . [SEP]  (A) They had a holiday . (B) They had an all expense paid trip to Germany . (C) They had to go to war in a few days . (D) None of the above choices .
column2: They had a holiday .

column1: What is the narrator seeking to improve ? [SEP] I do n't have high hopes of coming to agreement ... but perhaps moving toward civility would be a good step . I was a little shaken up after the board meeting , and did n't really get to see much . I hung out at the Woodford Gallery for a while and talked with Mary Christopher - I ' m going to start heading down to her studio every few weeks to learn from her . column1: Why is the narrator so mopey lately ? [SEP] After my last interraction with him , I had decided that he told me the truth and really did n't have any issue with me . column2: The narrator underwent a split .

column1: Why will you miss her ? [SEP] I think I ' m going to miss her a lot when she leaves , since it 's kinda like having a sister around or something . She 's invited me to stay with her in Japan for a bit , so since I plan on going back to Japan next May for another Study Abroad , I am going to stay a bit longer and then I can meet her family and spend time with her . [SEP]  (A) I have feelings for her (B) She was romantic with me (C) She was like a mother to me (D) We spent a lot of time together
column2: We spent a lot of time together

column1: Are you fond of animals ? [SEP] Here at Camp Critter when I ' ve had enough of interacting with people I can wander about 20 feet and interact with sheep or dogs .
